metadata.Title: CVE-2022-27666 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A heap buffer overflow flaw was found in IPsec ESP transformation code innet/ipv4/esp4.c and net/ipv6/esp6.c. This flaw allows a local attacker witha normal user privilege to overwrite kernel heap objects and may cause alocal privilege escalation threat.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-27666` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-175-generic - 4.15.0-175.184~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-175-generic - 4.15.0-175.184~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-175-lowlatency - 4.15.0-175.184~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1126-aws - 4.15.0-1126.135~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1136-azure - 4.15.0-1136.149~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1120-gcp - 4.15.0-1120.134~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1091-oracle - 4.15.0-1091.100~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-175.184~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1126.135~16.04.2').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1136.149~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1120.134~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.100~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
